Posts.Content: This might be a daft question but as I’m new to this I don’t know. I’ve been invited on a spa day but it falls on the weekend of my first week of radiotherapy. Will I be able to go? I understand some treatments will be out of the question but feel I need a bit of pampering after what I’ve been through.
Posts.Title: This might be a silly question

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies
Posts.Title: This might be a silly question

Posts.Content: We try to carry on and make our life as ‘normal’ as possible don’t we? So on the outside, too others, we look ‘normal’, ‘better’, ‘well’, but on the inside we’re like ducks, frantically paddling to keep our heads above water, constantly worried it will return, every little ache and pain is now a worry, ‘does it get any better?’ we wonder, or will life forever be like this now?
Posts.Title: You must be nearly better now!!! What a whimp!

Posts.Content: Hi, I work in the administration department at a high school, there are 14 of us in admin and I’m the third to have had bc. Along with the headteacher and 2 other support staff (one lady was diagnosed the week after me so we went through our treatment together). So that’s 6 out of 70 female staff!
Posts.Title: Amount of people with breast cancer

Posts.Content: I asked my oncologist this question last week, her reply was they wouldn’t advise a test as I’m over 50 and got no history of cancer in my family (apart from my dad who had prostrate cancer diagnosed 6 years ago but it’s contained and being treated by tablets). If I’d have been diagnosed in my 30/40s then I would’ve automatically been given the test
Posts.Title: Amount of people with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you so much, hope all goes well for you too xxx
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: Leo lady, Thank you so much, we’re all here to help each other get through this, we all have our up days and our down days don’t we? Hope everything is going well for you Xx
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: I’m here again, worrying. I went back to work on Monday, been to the gym twice, nothing strenuous, just walked on treadmill for 20 minutes  and 10 minutes on exercise bike, then tonight, whoosh, I’m an emotional wreck again. My oncologist appointment is looming (Monday) and it’s back to reality, I’ve had cancer, I still need my “insurance “ treatment, I’m dreading them saying I need chemotherapy. Yes, I know it’s a small price to pay and there’s ladies on here a lot worse off than me, but I’m still scared. I didnt want all this, I want to turn the clock back to before when I felt normal. I’ll be fine again in the morning I’m sure. Just need to get it off my chest.
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: Sue They did mine at the same time as my op on 17th November, I saw consultant on 5th December and he said results would be back in two weeks, but my oncologist appointment isn’t until Monday so I’ve waited quite a while.
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your comments and the article, that’s what’s so good about this site, no matter how we feel, we can always find someone who has been there and understands what we are going through. Love and hugs to you all xxx
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: Thank you. I’ve had the oncotype test, I’ll get results when I go on Monday. Xx
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: It's been a week since I was diagnosed and what a roller coaster week it has been!  Im determined to be positive but every so often I get a "wobble".  I too am scared of what the future may hold, but then hey, nothings for certain in life is it? Someone told me the other day that if you're destined to get cancer, this is the 'best one' , so that's a positive! I find it a great comfort chatting to people on here. keep your chin up and keep thinking positive, we're all in this together, we are strong and we CAN fight this! Xx
Posts.Title: Hi I've just been diagnosed with dcis I'm 31 and am awaiting an op...

Posts.Content: I should feel over the moon, my cancer has been taken away and it hasn’t spread, so why do I keep worrying it’s going to come back? One minute I’m fine, “ it’s gone, I’m better” then suddenly I get all emotional, snapping at my family, how do they know it’s gone? it could be somewhere else where they’ve not checked. Why is this happening to me? What have I done to deserve this? Will it ever really go away??
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: The cancer was found on my first routine mammogram, deep inside my breast so I never felt a lump. Im having surgery 17 th November to remo it and 2 lymph nodes, I haven't felt unwell still feel the same as I always have, that's why it's so hard to take in. you take care now xx
Posts.Title: Hi I've just been diagnosed with dcis I'm 31 and am awaiting an op...

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Gail, I’m positive most of the time but every so often get a little wobble. Hope all is well for you xx
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies x
Posts.Title: Spa day

Posts.Content: I’m going on a spa day tomorrow and someone’s told me I won’t be able to have any treatments due to my recent breast cancer (I had lumpectomy in November and finished radiotherapy in March). Ive booked a facial, should I go ahead?
Posts.Title: Spa day

Posts.Content: I have an appointment with my breast surgeon next week. I really don’t want to go through another operation as I don’t feel ready emotionally but my right boob is considerably smaller (& more pert) than my “normal” boob.  I thought I could live with it but when I saw the oncologist she remarked on how it had shrunk and asked if it bothered me! I keep looking now and wondering if it’s noticeable. Hubby said not to worry about it. I received the letter from the oncologist appointment and she mentioned in there how it had shrunk too! I just wish she’d kept her thoughts to herself. I really don’t know what to do now, as I said before, I don’t feel up to another op.  I know I’m lucky to have got rid of the cancer and shouldn’t worry about my appearance but it’s really got to me
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction yes or no?

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies much appreciated xxx
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hiya I had my operation 3 weeks ago tomorrow. I find I’m not in too much pain each morning but as the day goes on it gets worse (perhaps a sign that I’m trying to do too much?).  Had my results on Tuesday (good news, cancers gone and no sign of it spreading), consultant said I should be ok to drive now, but there’s no way I’d feel confident enough to drive yet due to pain in my arm. I’m trying to rest as much as I can but it’s so frustrating isn’t it? Especially at this time of year. I have managed to do almost all my Christmas shopping without entering a single shop this year though! I’m still taking painkillers (paracetamol) at the moment but trying to reduce them to once a day now just before bedtime, I’ve found the excercises help too. Stay positive, keep taking the tablets, persevere with the exercises and it WILL get better Sending hugs xx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and Sentinol Node Biopsy 3 weeks ago.

Posts.Content: Boobylou I was told to drink 2-3 litres of water a day, it really does help (apart from the constant trips to the loo
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I’ve had my first session today and feel like I’ve run a marathon. I’m usually fit too, gym 3 times a week, plenty of long walks with my dog, but I’m just being a couch potato tonight
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Does anyone know if they still do radiotherapy if you’re unwell. My daughters at home off sick with sickness bug and I’m terrified I’m going to catch it and it will affect my treatment (I’m on day 6/23). She’s staying in her room away from me bless her and I’m spraying anti bacterial spray everywhere and overdosing on the hand sanitizer but just know I’ll get it
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: The hikes not so bad violet, I’m almost at the bottom of the mountain now and it feels good, look after yourself xx
Posts.Title: Something I’d like to share

Posts.Content: Sorry for making you cry, hope you’re treatments going well xx
Posts.Title: Something I’d like to share

Posts.Content: Some sent me this today, thought I’d share it: What’s it like to go through cancer treatment? It’s something like this: One day, you’re minding your own business, you open the fridge to get some breakfast, and OH MY GOD THERE’S A MOUNTAIN LION IN YOUR FRIDGE. Wait, what? How? Why is there a mountain lion in your fridge? NO TIME TO EXPLAIN. RUN! THE MOUNTAIN LION WILL KILL YOU! UNLESS YOU FIND SOMETHING EVEN MORE FEROCIOUS TO KILL IT FIRST! So you take off running, and the mountain lion is right behind you. You know the only thing that can kill a mountain lion is a bear, and the only bear is on top of the mountain, so you better find that bear. You start running up the mountain in hopes of finding the bear. Your friends desperately want to help, but they are powerless against mountain lions, as mountain lions are godless killing machines. But they really want to help, so they’re cheering you on and bringing you paper cups of water and orange slices as you run up the mountain and yelling at the mountain lion - “GET LOST, MOUNTAIN LION, NO ONE LIKES YOU” - and you really appreciate the support, but the mountain lion is still coming. Also, for some reason, there’s someone in the crowd who’s yelling “that’s not really a mountain lion, it’s a puma” and another person yelling “I read that mountain lions are allergic to kale, have you tried rubbing kale on it?” As you’re running up the mountain, you see other people fleeing their own mountain lions. Some of the mountain lions seem comparatively wimpy - they’re half grown and only have three legs or whatever, and you think to yourself - why couldn’t I have gotten one of those mountain lions? But then you look over at the people who are fleeing mountain lions the size of a monster truck with huge prehistoric saber fangs, and you feel like an asshole for even thinking that - and besides, who in their right mind would want to fight a mountain lion, even a three-legged one? Finally, the person closest to you, whose job it is to take care of you - maybe a parent or sibling or best friend or, in my case, my husband - comes barging out of the woods and jumps on the mountain lion, whaling on it and screaming “GODDAMMIT MOUNTAIN LION, STOP TRYING TO EAT MY WIFE,” and the mountain lion punches your husband right in the face. Now your husband (or whatever) is rolling around on the ground clutching his nose, and he’s bought you some time, but you still need to get to the top of the mountain. Eventually you reach the top, finally, and the bear is there. Waiting. For both of you. You rush right up to the bear, and the bear rushes the mountain lion, but the bear has to go through you to get to the mountain lion, and in doing so, the bear TOTALLY KICKS YOUR ASS, but not before it also punches your husband in the face. And your husband is now staggering around with a black eye and bloody nose, and saying “can I get some help, I’ve been punched in the face by two apex predators and I think my nose is broken,” and all you can say is “I’M KIND OF BUSY IN CASE YOU HADN’T NOTICED I’M FIGHTING A MOUNTAIN LION.” Then, IF YOU ARE LUCKY, the bear leaps on the mountain lion and they are locked in epic battle until finally the two of them roll off a cliff edge together, and the mountain lion is dead. Maybe. You’re not sure - it fell off the cliff, but mountain lions are crafty. It could come back at any moment. And all your friends come running up to you and say “that was amazing! You’re so brave, we’re so proud of you! You didn’t die! That must be a huge relief!” Meanwhile, you blew out both your knees, you’re having an asthma attack, you twisted your ankle, and also you have been mauled by a bear. And everyone says “boy, you must be excited to walk down the mountain!” And all you can think as you stagger to your feet is “f*ck this mountain, I never wanted to climb it in the first place.”
Posts.Title: Something I’d like to share

Posts.Content: Hi i know just how you feel, I was diagnosed on 24th October, 3 days before my sons engagement party, first 2 days I thought and spoke of nothing else, would I be here for their wedding in 2019?, would I ever be a grandmother, my daughter was just about to start a new job, how will my husband cope. Then, hey the party was upon me, buffet to prepare, decorations to sort out, and I actually had a great time (perhaps the wine helped a little). Then I went back to work last Monday, I was dreading telling everyone but they were brilliant, I was really busy and it once again helped me 'forget' for a while. It is getting easier, I still get 'wobbles' still worry what the futrue holds for me. But until I've had my lumpectomy on 17th November I won't know what treatment I need.  Keep trying to be positive, I know it's hard but we can get through this, once you get talking to people it's amazing how common this pesky disease is, nearly every one I've spoken to knows someone who's been there and are fine now. sending you hugs xx julie xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hope you are feeling better now, I received a copy of the letter that the hospital sent to my GPs today and once I'd read it I cried like a baby, think it's just seeing it all written down in black and white made it seem more real. I still have another week before my op and will be a couple more weeks before I know the outcome. I just don't know how I'm going to get through it. I feel so scared
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks Anna i feel better now, daughter came home from work and gave me a hug, explained some of the medical terminology to me (Its now confirmed I have saggy boobies ). Then hubby came home and treated me to a pub dinner. its strange how we can be fine one minute, major wobble another then ok again isnt it? thanis for your kind words, hope you are ok sending hugs xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer
